seo.meta_title: Old Speck Mountain Trail Guide | 2 Routes, Maps & Conditions
seo.meta_description: Plan your Old Speck Mountain hike with live conditions, 2 trail maps & parking info. NH 4000-Footer at 4,170 ft.

schema_place.name: Old Speck Mountain
schema_place.description: Old Speck Mountain is a 4,170 foot peak in Maine offering hiking trails with scenic views.

mainEntity.name: How long does it take to hike Old Speck Mountain?

acceptedAnswer.text: Most routes on Old Speck Mountain take 3-5 hours round trip. The most popular trail is 7.6 miles with Hard difficulty. Start early, especially on weekends when parking fills quickly.

mainEntity.name: Is Old Speck Mountain hard to hike?

acceptedAnswer.text: Old Speck Mountain is rated Hard. At 4,170 feet, expect challenging terrain above treeline with potential for rapid weather changes. Proper footwear and preparation are essential.

mainEntity.name: Do I need a permit to hike Old Speck Mountain?

acceptedAnswer.text: No hiking permit is required for Old Speck Mountain. However, parking fees may apply at trailheads (typically $3-5/day for WMNF or state parks). A WMNF parking pass covers most White Mountain trailheads.

mainEntity.name: What is the best trail to hike Old Speck Mountain?

acceptedAnswer.text: The most popular route is the Old Speck Trail (AT), offering AT route to summit fire tower with excellent views over Mahoosuc Range..

mainEntity.name: When is the best time to hike Old Speck Mountain?

acceptedAnswer.text: The best hiking season for Old Speck Mountain is late May through October. Summer and fall offer the best conditions, though expect crowds on weekends. Winter hiking requires specialized gear and experience.

page_content.description:
At 4,170 feet, Old Speck Mountain ranks among New Hampshire's celebrated 4000-Footers—a collection of 48 peaks that challenge and inspire hikers throughout the Northeast. This hard summit offers a quintessential White Mountain experience.

Popular Routes

The most popular route, **Old Speck Trail (AT)**, covers 7.6 miles and is rated Hard. AT route to summit fire tower with excellent views over Mahoosuc Range.

Peak Bagging

**Extend Your Adventure:** Step Falls lies just 5.6 miles away, making it an excellent addition for ambitious hikers looking to bag multiple summits.

spring.title: Spring Conditions
spring.conditions: Muddy trails, snow above 3000ft until May
spring.tips: Trail closures for mud season (April-May). Check conditions before heading out.

summer.title: Summer Conditions
summer.tips: Start early to avoid afternoon storms and parking issues. Peak crowds on weekends.

fall.title: Fall Conditions
fall.conditions: Peak foliage late Sept, early snow possible in October
fall.tips: Peak foliage brings peak crowds. Weekday hikes recommended. Watch for ice above treeline in late October.

winter.title: Winter Conditions
winter.conditions: Full winter conditions, extreme cold and wind above treeline
winter.tips: Winter hiking requires specialized skills and gear. Never hike alone. Check avalanche conditions for steeper terrain.

current_hazards: ⚠️ ALPINE ZONE: Weather changes rapidly. Turn back if conditions deteriorate.
Winter conditions in effect - full mountaineering gear required
Hypothermia risk - temperatures 20-40°F colder at summit
Trail markers may be buried under snow
